intro: Urocarpidium pentandrum, commonly known as the five-stamen liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its simple, thallus-like structure with a distinct central axis and lateral lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures include male and female gametophytes, which are borne on separate plants. Urocarpidium pentandrum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
